reviews.review:
My favorite past-time game ðŸ’¯ I think that many people do often look for more elements in the game so it doesn't feel as repetitive, although more updates come and they provide more interesting things that all the devs work very hard on, so not much can really be complained about. Although, I do think implementing a particular thing I had in mind would be kinda cool (I'm certain, though, that this has crossed someone else's mind as well at some point). Players can interact with the characteristics of their killer by buying certain accessories and choose how their killer is put together in 3 sections (head, body, weapon). But the persona and personality of the killers are predetermined. What I had in mind, was focused on the "Mori" action. Each killer has their own course of action when preforming a "Mori", such as the Doctor will shock the survivor, the Nurse will choke the survivor, the Clown cuts their finger off and gives it a taste, etc. Each "Mori" gives the killer personality. So, where am I going with this? 
--->> What if the players were able to choose how their killers "Mori" looked like? :0  Each "Mori" would still take the same amount of time, of course, to be fair. But, the players would be able to choose how their killer would "Mori", yet the "Mori" action can not be the same across different killers. Each would have multiple choices, but neither the same. This would provide the game with an extra element, and the players would find excitement in gathering 
(or trying to earn) new "Mori" actions, however possible or assigned that they may do so. 
     To balance this addition to killer personality, the same would be for survivors, but not as a "Mori". In terms of the survivor, players would be able to choose the stance/emote of their survivor in lobby. As most the survivors have their own little movement while waiting for lobby to begin the match, the player can choose what their survivor does when that motion begins. It's a small addition, but nonetheless does it add personality and makes the players feel they have more options. 
     I think it would be really cool if this was a thing, but as always I'm excited to see whatever the devs come out with and this will always be my favorite game <3 c:

After 1,9k hours, from november 2016 to november 2018, i still think this is a very good and enjoyable game! Love how you have to find pallets and windows to make distance from the killer to get some time to hide, perks are very good as well and i just love the concept! They also update the game quite often and release new killers and clothings in the store! One of the best games i've ever played and will probably be the game i've had the most fun playing, both alone and with friends! Just play

[b] Hear me. Please [/b]

[i][h1] I demand a response from the developers! [/h1][/i]
  Dear developers of this game. I, as a faithful and honest player of this game, assure you that I am tired ... Tired of the fact that you cannot make a lobby, so that I and my friends could quietly be in the same party. Actually, it turns out this way - you have to constantly throw your friends an invitation to join a lobby. I ask you to fix this ailment at last. Sincerely your friendly Frederick "Freddy" Charles Krueger.
  P.S. Game 9 out of 10 because of this minus.

Ð—Ð°Ñ…Ð¾Ð´Ð¸ Ð¸ Ð¸Ð³Ñ€Ð°Ð¹, Ð²Ñ‹Ñ…Ð¾Ð´Ð¸ Ð½Ðµ Ð¿Ð»Ð°Ñ‡ÑŒ )

10/10 - would die again

Though to be honest, there's some serious balancing issues in this game. I'm addicted so I can't stop playing, but I don't know how this game manages to be completely biased towards both killers and survivors at the same time.

As a killer, you constantly get "Survive With Friends" groups which is like going up against four boss characters at the same time, constant flashlight saves and  just surrounding you when you try to hook a survivor. Teabagging you when they are near an exit gate or just holding the game hostage by crouching behind various objects and just being an immersed gamer. It's also pretty fun to chase a survivor and get stunned by a pallet, only to be blinded immediately after. Basically any action you take as the killer is a free flashlight blind. Survivor running, but you need to break the pallet? Blind. Vaulting over a window? Blind. Literally being stunned by a pallet? Blind. Picking up a survivor? Blind. That's not even mentioning the BM you see; pallet stuns followed by teabags and flashlight flicking, survivors fast vaulting over a pallet over and over again so it makes a loud noise so you come investigate, only to reveal that the escape hatch was there and now they're gone; things that just don't need to be done but do so because the community is just that toxic.

As a suvivor, unless you're playing with 3 friends, you constantly get morons hiding in closets, people blowing up generators and then sprint bursting away, and the killer finding you first without fail; running them around for close to 10 minutes and then a single generator is completed by your Meghead teammates - but then you go down and what's this? Someone else has your decisive strike! So you wiggle until you can DS and hit it, only for one of your teammates to block your window trying to run away from the scary killer, causing you to get hit and go down again. Then once you're hooked, the killer facecamps you to make sure you do, but your survivors aren't able to come save you until you are in struggle state. At which point, they will run directly towards you and pull you off the hook while the killer chases them, effectively farming you, running away as you get hooked again and die. Then if you spectate, 5 seconds later, all of the generators are done and your three teammates are teabagging at the exit gates. Two of them run and get away but one gets hit with the NOED and gets hooked.

What I just described is a typical run of this game. If it sounds fun to you, get it. If it doesn't, get it anyway and try it out. You might get hooked (as in addicted, though you will also probably get hooked several times as a survivor). 

Final score; 7/10. Fun but horrible unabalanced. Always feels like the game was either too easy or impossible, no matter which side you play.
